title: The negotiations that led to the release of two French hostages in Iran
subhead: The two union activists, Cécile Kohler and Jacques Paris, were granted conditional release after over three years in prison and allowed to enter France's embassy in Tehran, but are still banned from leaving the country.

title: Anesthetist accused of poisoning patients continues to deny at trial
subhead: Frédéric Péchier stands accused of poisoning 30 people, 12 of whom died. He has admitted that poisonings occurred, while firmly rebuffing prosecutors' attempts to incriminate him.

title: Emmanuel Carrère wins Prix Médicis for 'Kolkhoze'
subhead: Carrère's latest book is about his mother, Hélène Carrère d'Encausse (1929-2023), a Russian historian and perpetual secretary of the Académie Française, with whom relations were never easy.

subhead: 'Our planet at +1.5°C' (6/6). Persistent drought, record temperatures, wildfires: Faced with the most acute effects of global warming, residents of the Aude department in southern France are looking for ways to keep their region alive.

title: A tunnel between Morocco and Spain, an old dream revived
subhead: Since the 19th century, the idea of a fixed link between Morocco and Europe has seen slow but steady progress. If realized, the project could transform the movement of people and goods across the western Mediterranean.

title: Understanding Shein's sex doll scandal in five questions
subhead: After France's consumer watchdog found childlike sex dolls on Shein's site, the Chinese e-commerce platform said it would 'fully cooperate with the judicial authorities,' raising questions about its content moderation.
